The rooms are budget, but like i say they were clean and comfy. Things like hairdryers are available on request. But tea and coffee are supplied and rooms made up daily. The towels are small and only one pillow is provided. However i am sure if we had asked they would have offered us some more, but we didnt see the need. They are refurbing between the hours of 9 and 5, but we werent there and there was no evidence to show anything was happening, apart from banging on the first morning at 1030am. The hotel had a lot of business people from the excel centre and school children from abroad. Niether caused us any bother at all. The hotel itself was located about 2mins from the royal victoria stop on the DLR. We bought a day travel card at 8 pounds each and changed at canning town for the tube. Canning town is one stop from Royal Victoria and One stop from the o2. We went into london on both days and it took s about 20 to 30 mins depending on were we were heading. We ate at the o2 on both nights as it has a good selection of bars and resturants. We had no trouble getting about and saw lots of sights. The tube is being upgraded at the weekends so be mindful of this. The bus replacements are frequent but not as quick as the tube. Your travel card will be valid on these. London as usual is pricey but a good getaway. AS for the ibis its a great hotel. Breakfast was buffet style and varied in its selection. The bottom line is i travel frequently and know you go were you can afford. Ibis isnt glitzy or glamourous but it serves its purpose well as a base. If you want comfort and some where to rest your weary feet go here. If you want the added extras go elsewhere. I will use this hotel again and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Excel”
Reviews.Author: richandliz28
Reviews.Content: Good access for DLR & Excel centre - don't stay here if you're looking to visit London "proper" for sightseeing or theatre, as it's a long way in and back out again. We were going to an event at the Excel so the location was ideal for us. Efficient check-in. Rooms were being refurbished during our stay, but we weren't affected by noise or paint fumes, even though they were working on the same floor. We were on 7th floor of 8, and there didn't seem to be anyone else on our floor or above us - or at least, we weren't kept awake by noisy neighbours! :-) The room was clean and compact with basic facilities - tv, kettle etc. Unbranded tea & UHT supplied, but no biscuits - this is a 'budget' hotel, after all. Had read on here that they only supply two teabags (this is true) so we brought our own teabags & milk so we could have a cuppa whenever we wanted. Comfy bed, total 3 pillows in the room, 10.5 tog duvet but the window opens enough for fresh air (close to the airport, but the flights don't go at all hours). There's no safe or ironing facilities in the room, and no free wifi throughout the hotel. Bathroom functional, walk-in shower, some sort of showergel provided & a teeny bar of soap at the basin. Main gripe here - the bath towels are really TINY, thin and threadbare. We left them to be changed for our 2nd night in the hope of better ones, but the fresh ones had proper holes in! So to the rest - the hotel bar is small and was very noisy when we stopped by for a pre-dinner drink on the Friday night. We didn't eat in the hotel, so can't comment on food. Locally, there are a few places to eat within very short walking distance. The curry house dished up good food - eventually. Given that the waiter's complete ineptitude from start to finish meant he missed some stuff off the bill, we decided not to complain ;-) The Italian (Zero Seven) would probably have been great on any other night. Unfortunately, there were too many staff on for the number of diners, so we were literally pounced on by various different waiting staff from the moment we sat down until we asked for the bill at the end. Can't recommend the food, either, as we thought the least an under-used kitchen could manage would be to heat the food before sending it out... We usually stay in Novotels and this was our first foray into the world of Ibis. On the whole, if we were going back to another exhibition at the Excel, we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money review”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: the !00 pound per night was not good value, this should have cost about 60 pound sterling otherwise good facility, public transport is a challenge from the location but other wise a good quiet place to stay and away from the hussle and bussle of down town hotels. there is evan a wonderful place to walk around.its not advertised. even the exhibition groumds are not indiacted in the advert for the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Decent value/experience for the money”
Reviews.Author: GMK1954
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Ibis was a decent value for the money. We stayed 5 nights. It's a bit far from central London, so access to nightlife was a little limited. The DLR was a 5 min walk and easy to find. Our room was clean, size was about what we expected (not overly large), and the bathroom was not too small. The shower design was one where water tended to collect on the bathroom floor, unfortunately (standing, no bathtub). No major problems with hearing noises from upstairs/other rooms. Small TV had a few UK channels and 1/2 channels from other European nations. The front desk could have been a little more helpful - they did not seem very interested when we showed up to check in, and initially tried to tell us that our stay did not include breakfast (which in fact we did pay for when we booked the room - they later caught their mistake). No such problems at check out. There was a medium-sized supermarket out front which was very convenient and open till fairly late. Other than a few other hotels and the Excel center, there didn't seem to be much else out here. The breakfast was good and had a lot of different foodstuffs... unfortunately it was the same food everyday! With the variety though, it wasn't that bad. One busy day though the coffee seemed to run out, we couldn't find any ketchup, and the staff seemed slightly overwhelmed. We did eat dinner once and although it wasn't cheap, it was quite tasty. The signs for breakfast said 6am to whenever, but this was misleading. On our last day we had to catch an early AM flight and when we went down at 6... the restaurant area was not setup. The staff did quickly bring us a few small items, but obviously it was not what I expected. Overall nothing exceptional, but a slightly better than average experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed, nice view that was it!”
Reviews.Author: x--NIKKINOO--x
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because we were going to the o2. It is in good distance from there! The only down side I would say is that when we stayed we had to order foor at midnight because thats when we were back at the hotel. After getting back from the o2 the bar was filled with rugby players that were staying there, we were hesitant to order food but then saw there was a seperate room for 24/7 food, so we thought oh okay then! Ordered the food and then asked the man if we should wait in the seated restaurant bit, he then told us it was closed and we would have to wait at the bar (with no available seats) He did not give us any ideas of what we would like to do or did not bring us out any chairs for an empty table where the rugby players had taken the chairs.. Before ordering we also asked how long the food would take, they said up to 15 mins. 40 minutes later and the food finally arrived!! (with a ten minute gap between each meal). We asked where we were going to sit and he said that we will have to take it up to our room! So we had to carry out plates and drinks up 6 floors with no offer of any help!! My husband ordered the ice cream dessert too and so asked for that to take up with him too other wise he is going to have to go all the way back down just to get hois icecream, this took the barman another 5 minutes to do! By the time we got up stairs we were just too shattered and our food was cold from his dilly dallying and having to take it up 6 levels! My stuffed crust pizza was also stuffed with tomato, not the popular cheese choice, maybe they should put that on the menu!? In the morning I heard the loudest bunch of cleaners in the world! As they were walking past our door they thudded the door with their hoover! I was woken up over 5 times while they were cleaning, I know it is a mad rush for them in the morning as I have worked in a hotel myself but the amount of noise they made was not neccessary! Also the only bin they have was a little one in the bathroom? and no plug next to the mirror in the sleeping area. The only staff I met were the night staff who were very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: CelticPathfinder
Reviews.Content: Booked IBIS just for one night as I wanted to be near the Excel centre. Got a great deal of around £60 B & B. Room was large , clean and comfortable and the bathroom large with a good walk in shower. Hotel looks pretty new. Short walk to the DLR Royal Victoria station. Had dinner in a good chinese restaurant just 3 mins walk from the hotel. It is a shame that IBIS hotels in the UK do not provide free wifi to guests. Breakfast was a bit chaotic with one coffee machine out of action and every time I got up from my table to get something from the buffet someone else had sat down at my place or the staff had cleared my plates away before I had finished. Overall good value for money and location in Victoria Dock

Reviews.Title: “overall Nice. Good location and views. reasonable price too.”
Reviews.Author: t2t_time2travel
Reviews.Content: Nice simple hotel. -Staff were average though and did lack knowledge of local surroundings. great restaurants within 5mins walk and small stores for food. Hotel restaurant has limited options, not very vegetarian friendly. room was simple, stylish and clean :) two minutes walk from royal victoria station, DRL line. shame tubes were expensive as its in zone 5 though. Would still recommend this hotel. enjoyed our 2nights there but is somewhere for a good weekend or nights sleep, not enough facilities for a long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were exhibiting at the MCN Excel motorcycle show and the Ibis is 2 minutes walk, good value for money but they could do with a couple more members of staff however, more staff means more overheads and the price would go up! Overall very good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Awful room, but very close to ExCel Center”
Reviews.Author: Gabacorn
Reviews.Content: Awful food, matchbox size rooms and a capsule bathroom. Try to spend more time outside of the hotel then inside. It is very close to the convention center. Utilize the store across the street for food, water and beverages. Very far from LHR. Close to City Airport.

Reviews.Title: “communication Problems=poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times. On every ocassion i have found that the staff probably mean well but their attitude and along with their so called approach to customer service is intolerable at times.Proper training is much needed.The way most of the staff communicate with the customers or not as is the case here, make you feel very frustrated especially when the request is a relatively simple one. A good example of this is product knowledge at the bar when ordering a drink. The excuse is either i am new here, i have never worked the bar before or i dont understand.this needs to change.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, mid range accommodation in fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: CornishWebDesigner
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 night in Jan 2011 for a business trip and paid £50/night through Laterooms. It was a very clean hotel with no frills in an amazing location. The bed was firm .. which would be my only thing I'd change .. the room was clean and modern, TV was OK .. restaurant served good food and breakfast was fine. Staff were friendly and helpful - there's a 24-hour bar for food and drinks. There was some noise from City Airport before 10pm .. which was fine with me. It's 3 mins walk from the DLR and about 250m from ExCeL. At the price I paid in London it was Phenomenal value .. and I'd def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, basic hotel - definately 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Janet66
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January for exhibition at Excel. Location is fantastic, short walk to exhibition hall. Very nice for watching planes take off and land at City Airport! (i don't mind it actually). 3 reception staff on arrival and all just stood there not taking any notice of me, we had the same problem when we checked out and went to collect our bags later, not very helpful at all. Room very basic although we had one facing the river with a view of the O2. Clean tidy with tea and coffee facilities - my only complaint was that the bathroom isn't very nice, the door doesn't reach the floor by at least an inch, not very nice if you want a bit of privacy. The breakfast was ok, plenty of cereal variety but the cooked food wasn't very nice, I had beans and they were very salty and I had to leave them. Muffins were very nice though. A basic hotel that does what it says on the tin, wouldn't give more than 3 stars and would not stay there again - even for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, beware the car park charge.”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beware the high car park charge if you use the Novotel car park next to the Ibis. £14 for the night!! This is not advertised on any web site.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was as expected for the price. The room we had was looking tired and in need of a spruce up. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I notice some people have said about not enough towels or pillows. We had the same problem but rang reception and within 5 minutes they had brought us some more. Good location for the Excel centre and wonderful views of the Thames. Secure car parking was good and only £14 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “london calling!”
Reviews.Author: thegorbs Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: ibis docklands is a great hotel, right on the trendy waterfront, and a short walk from the tube station. there are 2 convienience stores within 500m and enough restaurants to satisfy your palate. the staff were friendly, quick to respond to any troubles we had.

Reviews.Title: “feedback”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: In general I was satisfied with my stay in this hotel. I would recommend this hotel for a leisure travelling. I get a quality service for a resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, tired room”
Reviews.Author: rpaters
Reviews.Content: There were only 2 small towels in the bathroom, when we asked for more we were told to collect as we returned as there was no room service or maids available. The bathroom smelled of raw sewage. There was a cigarette burn in the shower tray. The room furnishings were old and chipped. The bed appears to have no base, only a plinth that is part of the floor, matress is thin and uncomfortable. There was what appeared to be dried mud on the bed linen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, low on basics”
Reviews.Author: unicorncr
Reviews.Content: First of all make sure you check if you are at the Ibis Docklands or the Dicklands ExCel - I nearly took us to the wrong one!!! More distinctive names would have been useful!! We were staying here for an event at the O2 and it was a good location for that. One tube stop on the Jubilee line from the O2 and approx a 15-20 minute walk (you can use the DLR to get closer but it was shut for engineering work when we stayed!) The ExCel centre is signposted from Canning Town tube so it's very easy to get to by foot from there. I was a little disappointed that you only get one towel each and that is defintely on the small side (I'm used to the heady supply of two you get at a travelodge!!) We had a lovely room looking over the docks and the area was very quiet. There was a small 7-11 type shop across the way and a couple of restaurants. Overall not bad for the £50 paid and a fab location for the O2

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: juzclique Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Good if you have an event in Excel. Quite a distance if you are here for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: skimblejones
Reviews.Content: Another good example of the Ibis (brand) - they vary - this one is just fine in every way and very good value. Though a bit out of London the DLR provides excellent and easy public transport. We did not eat in the hotel, but had dinner in the Novotel next door (a la carte MUCH better and no more expensive than the rather stewed looking buffe) - and in the morning walked across the docks to the London Barrier Park for a very reasonable breakfast in the cafe there - with great views through trees of the Thames Barrier itself. Then back on the DLR via the London Docklands Museum (free) by West India Quay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, bad cleaner!!!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The room was really really clean the day we arrived but we stayed there for 7 days and the cleaner just make the bed the days after, so imagine the mountain of dust in our night tables, tv, desks, etc, after one week...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my partner for 2 days, it was a great location, the room was very clean and comfortable. It was located in a beautiful, peaceful, and convenient area and was well worth the price. The cleaning staff were particularly helpful and nice, however, the majority of the staff at reception were extremely rude, unwelcoming and unwillling to help with any queries (however I was prepared for the rudeness of the staff as so many other reviews stated this as the major downside to the hotel). If you do not have to talk to or deal with the reception staff, it is a perfect hotel, but if you do have the misfortune of needing to deal with the staff it really ruins your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bother”
Reviews.Author: Babyboo123
Reviews.Content: Basic hotel that just can't get the basics right. Long queues to check in, an hour to locate a remote control for room tv (and can't be operated without it) and ineffectual heating. Never again

Reviews.Title: “Dont book here unless you want to risk losing your money!”
Reviews.Author: hcw777
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Ibis Hotel,London Docklands on 10th July 2010. When my husband arrived to check in there were no rooms available even though I had prepaid for one for him. I am still waiting for my money back now over 3 months on. I have been offered compensation by means of vouchers in euros even though I paid in pounds on my mastercard. These supposedly were sent sometime in September - I have yet to receive them. I have made numerous phonecalls and sent numerous emails to no avail. I would appreciate a comment back from the management as to why I have not been refunded the money I paid in good faith.

Reviews.Title: “good value and better than expected”
Reviews.Author: howesmandy
Reviews.Content: after reading other trip advisor reviews we arrived a t this hotel with some concerns.however there wasnt any wait at reception our rooms were excellent value for money and clean with tea and coffee making facilities. the shower was huge and bathroom very clean and well presented. we had breakfast which was fine but you need to be there before 8.15 to avoid a very busy time overall excellent and handy for o2 arena

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay this hotel if you just want to visit center of London”
Reviews.Author: 7traveler77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good for the business people,not for travelers.It's take about one hour to the center of London each way.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!”
Reviews.Author: HolliDublin
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my 7 year old daughter for 2 nights 23rd and 24th Sept.. I have to say i absolutely loved it!!! and i have stayed at 5 star hotels in london which weren't as good as this Ibis.. The staff were lovely and i know someone mention that alot of the staff seem to be foreign - well maybe but they are so nice,friendly and professional at all times.. The girl at reception rebecca was so professional at her job and we were only about 10 mins checking in even though it was so busy... she did apologise. I have to mention the cleaning staff because the hotel in spotless - out bedroom was really clean.. there was clean towels and soap left outside our door the next day as we had the DO NOT DISTURB sign up.. we did have breakfast for the 2 mornings we were there and it was quite adequate. It was 5.50 and well worth it as there was everything to choose from.. The trip to London was only 25 mins via the DLR from Royal Victoria to Canning town. Then change for the Jubilee hotel. if you have book this hotel - you are in for a treat!! the prices for 5 star is horrendous in london and this hotel offers better.. i will be using this hotel chain the future and whoever the manager is of this hotel - he does a fine good job as the staff work as a team!!!

Reviews.Title: “London on a budget”
Reviews.Author: gazuk95 Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you want to visit London on a tight budget, The hotel is basic, but comfortable and only a 5 minute walk away from the nearest tube station. The staff were polite, and check in was quick and hastle free. We've eaten at the hotel bar during a previous stay and the food was acceptable and good value for money. Breakfast is basic, so if you prefer it with all the trimmings I'd recommend going into the city centre. Remember to check that the DLR is running (especially if you're visiting at weekend) as scheduled closures for maintenance can really slow down your journey to and from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Overnight Stay- Close to transport links.”
Reviews.Author: austin_mini69
Reviews.Content: My fiancée and I stayed at the Ibis Docklands Hotel for one night, for a flight from London City Airport at 9am the next day. It was easy to get to, and in a really good location to get anywhere, but particularly for the airport. The staff were friendly and the staff at the reception desk were particularly good, being able to tell us about local transport links etc. The staff behind the bar had a bit of an argument whilst we were paying for our food, which wasn't a particularly comfortable experience...but it soon settled down. The food from the bar in the evening was pretty good. Worth the £5.50 each we paid to fill a gap. They had dressed iceberg lettuce and cucumber with olive oil though, and while this was fine(ish) for us, it may not have been to everyone's taste...but a very small quibble. Most importantly, the room. Fine for one night, clean, comfortable and functional. The pictures on here are very representative of what we saw. The room didn't have a net curtain, which meant that when I threw back the curtain in the morning, I was met by the neighbours in a next door flat! But curtain was swiftly closed. The mattress was memory foam, which we are used to, but might be difficult to get used to for some! All in all, a pleasant stay...would use again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice price and nice location (close to DLR)”
Reviews.Author: mauriciocasal Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel, fair price for a clean room, reasonable breakfast and in a really location (it was close to the DLR transport line). I do recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Frankixxx
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I were going to London for the Rugby final, and to view the location of our wedding reception. So we decided we would make a weekend of it. We booked the Ibis London Excel, and stayed for three nights, Friday to Monday. The hotel staff were always polite and smiling. There was always plenty to choose from for breakfast. The hotel was always tidy. It is not too far out the way of central London. Just a straight couple of stops on the jubilee line from waterloo, then 2 stops on the DLR. We found it easy to travel around from the hotel. The only points that werent so great was the fact that the bed mattress was very thin, and you get one pillow per person, the towels in the bathroom are also very small. But I noticed that if you ask reception for more they will happily give some more. Overall, we had a fantastic stay. The price we paid was definitely a bargain. We are thinking of staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Loocation”
Reviews.Author: HSB25
Reviews.Content: Being next to the Excel centre this was a well located hotel within 20 mins walk of o2 centre. The room was clean and not too small. My internet cable was broken going from my tv so it kept falling out of my laptop. This was replaced by a member of staff but only after a number of calls to reception. The deal however that they offered on internet and unlimited movies was great. 9.99 for all movies and 24 hour internet access. The rooms were a little dusty so you do feel bunged up in the morning. It was a very popular place for tourists as I found out in the morning at breakfast as i stayed 2 nights and both mornings had different coachfulls of japanese tourists. Breakfast was good and there was plenty of it in a buffet style that had staff constantly replacing any empty items. All in all this was a decent hotel at 49 pounds for bed and breakfast in London!!!

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: sunshine505
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at the Ibis Docklands in August however it is not an experience I would wish to repeat. The rooms are tiny, the bed rock hard, and no hairdryer. The breakfast was very poor, the bacon tough and the scrambled eggs were white and totally tasteless. All in all a very disappointing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: ironlady2
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Hotel Ibis London Docklands. Although the hotel was very busy the staff were very helpful and accommodating, the room was extremely clean, breakfast was a bit chaotic but the choice on offer was substantial. Transport to and from the hotel was very easy via DLR. Only downside was the flight path for City Airport however the hotels double glazing compensated for that. Would definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “be careful with booking and canceling”
Reviews.Author: Floatey
Reviews.Content: I booked with Booking.com and then had to cancel , The Ibis still took the money for the one room booked and THEN EVEN TOOK money for a second room that WAS NOT BOOKED. I have spoken to at least four people and emailed more times than i can remember and i have still not have the money returned despite sending relevant details of cancelation via email !!!!!.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed opinion, budget but room for improvement.”
Reviews.Author: artgeko
Reviews.Content: We arrived early evening on Saturday after a day in the city. Check-in was smooth, staff friendly and polite. Room was adequate for a bed for the night. Had to go down to reception because only 1 pillow each and no spares in the room but they got 2 more straightaway, no bother. A/C was not very efficient and the room felt hot all night, window only opened a little and kept closing. Also seemed that mattress protector was plasticky, which added to the heat problem. We did not call reception about this because we were so tired. We had bought some food basics at the local Spar so that we did not have to leave our room until the morning. The Spar has everything you could need, very handy. Apart from the heat, the room was sufficient. Breakfast this morning was rather chaotic, too many people in at once, despite following the traffic light system for how busy it can be at certain times. Sunday breakfast is served until midday which would appeal to some. Some tables did not have chairs at them. Hotel very easy to find. We got the DLR from Tower Gateway to Royal Victoria, didn't take long and going back into central London was the same, and easy to pick up the bus to central London. For a budget hotel, I would consider staying here again but would research alternatives first. Not a patch on the Sydney Ibis we stayed in a year ago though.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the the train to London!”
Reviews.Author: Geo_Denmark
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, with okey rooms, very clean and very good value for money! It looks like it is very long from London center, but it took us only 20 minutes to get by train to the center. The parking, was very dire!

Reviews.Title: “very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: doyleyboy86
Reviews.Content: I read some terrible reviews on this hotel so decided to write this give our view. Firstly, this is a budget hotel..if you expect to be treated like a king and have all the amenities they have at say the ritz or royal garden then dont be so mean and go and pay ritz prices!! Why do some of these moaning minnies bother going anywhere?? The rooms were very adequate and clean, the beds comfortable and the staff very curtious.....and they served a very good breakfast...what else do you need for a london getaway. getting into central london was very easy, took about 20 mins and cost six quid each for a dlr/tube full day pass. my only critisism was that because we arrived mid evening on the first night we ate in the restaurant...this was a mistake as the service was unbelievebly slow and food very mediocre...after that we ate in town so no problem. you are quite close to the city of london airport so after 7am planes take off over the hotel but again, if your'e spending the day in london you should be thinking about getting up by then anyway. through superbreaks this hotel cost 56 quid per night for a three night stay (incl breakfast) and was very good value for money. We have stopped in the aforementioned hotels and you definately come away with a distinct feeling of bad value for money. The money saved by going for a budget hotel probably paid for all of our meals during our 3 day stay! We will definately go back

Reviews.Title: “budget,good hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbritishtraveller
Reviews.Content: want somewhere reasonably priced in london then this is just the place to be.Situated in the Docklands,close to 2 DLR stations,the O2 arena a stones throw away,the Excel arena really close.The staff are wonderful,the room basic but comfortable.There are a couple of convienience stores for the odd snack in close proximatey.for a nightcap the upperdeck a the novotel next door,or the Fox excel pub reached from the custom house station bridge,and from ground level to the left of the excel.It is only a DLR ride into the city,and from there on your worlds your oyster

Reviews.Title: “beautiful location, nice hotel, staff needs work”
Reviews.Author: mmegreen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a student tour in july 2010 (this review is for the Ibis london Docklands Excel-- right next to the excel center). The hotel is nice, new, and the location is beautiful, right on the canal. There are some restaurants nearby, the hotel bar/restaurant is open 24 hours, which is very handy and the prices are good. there are two small markets nearby, with long hours. the hotel itself, the rooms are sparse (this is an Ibis), the windows don't open all the way, but the AC is good, the bathroom reminded me of a cruise ship bathroom (no tub, only shower, step up, etc...). if i were staying here are a regular tourist though, I would have been disappointed because there were sooooo many groups here! we were just 1 of about about 4 student travel groups (each group being about 50 teens), and there were two adult japanese tour groups there during our stay as well. In general the kids were well behaved, but it made it very difficult to get on the hotel computers, breakfast was absolutely packed from about 8-9 every day, and the elevators took forever! As for the staff, well, since any member of the EU can move jobs between countries, it means that you have a lot of non-English staff-- they all speak English, but their comprehension levels vary. We had to explain 3 times about the light in our bathroom (it was blinking on and off-- thank goodness we were not epileptics, or else there could have been real problems). i tried, in vain, to solicit information abot cinemas and timetables (the staff referred me to the pamphlets about trips to stonehenge and the cotswolds)-- then told me that i would just have to get on the tube and travel to the movie theatre to find out if any movies were playing now, that i wanted to see. they did it with a smile, but i did not find it helpful to be told to take the tube down to canary wharf at 930pm to find out if there were still movies playing that night. they had nicely priced in room internet and movie plans, but the actual working order of these programs were spotty, at best-- in our group, atleast 5 rooms had difficulty connecting to the internet and watching the pay movies on tv (and they had to return to reception 3-6 times-- not a fun thing especially when they had to wait in line behind 3+ people every time). Overall, I think this hotel is a crapshoot-- their rates are good, it's off the DLR (which is fabulous), but if you're there with a group, or stuck there while several groups are there, then your experience is going to be different. It was beautiful though, with lots of benches out on the promenade.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: cbprater
Reviews.Content: This was my worst hotel experience in at least the last 500,000 miles of travel. I stayed at this hotel as it was selected as the conference hotel for a recent conference. I brought my family so that they could have a holiday abroad. The hotel was a disaster. First, the hotel is *extremely remote*. It takes an hour or more to get into central London by light rail and the tube. Next, the rooms are very small, barely sufficient for a solo business traveler and terrible for a family. The hotel is extremely crowded--the lobby, bar and restaurant were packed to overcrowding. The hotel is very loud--it seems to cater to children's tour groups, so we had pre-teens running and yelling down the halls at night. The restaurant's food is poor and the restaurant staff were rude and inattentive. The bathroom doors are so stiff that my 7 year old daughter couldn't get out of the bathroom by herself. We also had problems with the hotel laundry--the first day our laundry wasn't even sent out to be cleaned and the next day one of the garments returned damaged. Despite an advertisement of "fixed in 15 minutes or the room is free," none of these issues were addressed and the hotel refused to issue a refund of an unused night when we decided to depart early in disgust. If you must stay in this area, check out the other hotels nearby (including a Novotel and a Crowne Plaza). Better yet, stay somewhere more central to London and commute to your meeting. (There are limited restaurant choices, few tourist attractions and limited nightlife near the ExCel/Docklands area. Many more fun places closer to London proper.)

Reviews.Title: “well priced hotel in quiet location”
Reviews.Author: HotelValueHunter
Reviews.Content: I stay in the London ExCel exhibition and conference centre area at least 2 times a year. I write about all the hotels I stay in on the ExCel complex so I direct you to my user name to get my reviews on the other adjoining hotels I have stayed at. If you are travelling to this hotel on the DLR alight at Royal Victoria (RV) as there are fewer steps to carry luggage up and down. Out of the station across the zebra crossing and at 10 O' Clock is a wide path between the apartment blocks. Walk along this path and you come onto Western Gateway. Turn left and the IBIS comes up on your right hand side after about 250yds. This hotel is fantastic; I find no problem with the room size and the staff friendly. My room was cleaned everyday to my satisfaction and on checking in I asked for a room with a view of the dock and my request was granted. From reading other reports I think people are expecting too much for the room rate you pay. I have now stayed here 8 times in 5 years with nothing to really complain about (except small bath towels, and small ironing boards in the ironing rooms). The restaurant food is basic fayre but good value. I calculated the cheapest 3 course meal with a 0.5L bottle of still mineral water would cost about £15 per person. Bar service does get people very frustrated in this IBIS but the secret is to stay at this hotel and use the bar in the sister hotel Novotel right next door. The Novotel has a far superior bar but the prices are only about 20p dearer per pint. The Novotel has floor walkers, so once you have your seat the floor walker will take your order at your table and bring you your drinks. You just then settle up one bill at the end of your visit. You cannot charge the Novotel bar bill to your IBIS hotel room, which is the only real drawback. As they are part of the same hotel chain I do not see this as a big problem to sort out. This would benefit A-Club members to ensure they maximise their points earned from these two ACCOR hotels. If staying for a while, there are two convenience stores (SPAR, NISA) to get your hotel room supplies along Western Gateway. There are lots of eateries around the IBIS hotel and I found the quickest way to know where they all are is to pop into the ExCel centre next to the IBIS and get the free local restaurant guide from the information desk. The ExCel venue is open even if no events are happening and contains Coffee Bars and Newspaper/sweet shops and free cash machines. If you are staying at one of the on-site hotels this is a great bonus to be able to use these facilities. If you want a cheap light breakfast rather than pay hotel prices a bacon sandwich costs around £3 and there are plenty of tables and chairs down the main wide central isle to sit at and relax. I have also come across a WEB site which will be useful if you are staying at this hotel and visiting central London to see the sights. It is walkit.co.uk this site shows you the quickest walking route between two locations. If you are visiting London for the sights start your walking journey at Westminster Tube on the Jubilee line (change at Canning Town on the DLR). All the sites can be walked from here. walkit is a great site for seeing London on foot.

Reviews.Title: “An Experience”
Reviews.Author: lucydepper
Reviews.Content: My partner and I booked into the hotel as we were visiting the o2 areana that evening. We did not expect much just a room. We arrived and the hotel staff were friendly but did not speak much English when I asked for directions. The room was basic and clean. After the concert we came back to the hotel and had a couple of drinks in the hotel bar. The bar was quite busy with an American college trip and people who had been at the o2. The bar staff were awful!!! They were not bar staff they were reception staff. They did not know how to make a drink! They did not speak any English and started to argue with eachother. My partner and I found this very funny as we were not too bothered about drinking much, however many other guests got very annoyed. The bar was suppose to be open 24 hours. The closed at 2am as they could not cope. Many people still wanted to order food so at least four groups of people ordered tack away pizza into the hotel bar! The next morning we were woken up twice with difference maids coming into our bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Location great for Excel”
Reviews.Author: bootsieWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: This is a basic hotel - and expense for what you get but this is London. 2 minutes walk from Excel. Staff friendly and helpful. Restaurant not inspiring. Breakfast very average. Bar OK. Don't bring your car -£30 per night to park

Reviews.Title: “Will NEVER go again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kates1Suffolk
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ibis when I was in London doing an exhibition, I arrived and wasn't even greeted at all! The woman who was at reception was rude - it was like she couldn't even understand me. I work in the travel industry and customer service is very important to me. We ate at the hotel to try and 'save some money' but we ended up paying a ridiculous amount for about 8 chips and a tiny piece of chicken. The waitress we had was also rude! The room was OK, nothing special. Overall the staff were terrible and I would never return to this hotel, and I will be telling my clients to avoid it also!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: AlexaTorino
Reviews.Content: Close to DLR stop Custom House. Basic rooms, but clean. Breakfast is also complete and the lobby staff is very kind. Close to the hotel a supermarket and some restaurants and bars. Very close to Excel. Free wifi connection would be great.

Reviews.Title: “The WORST ibis Hotel in UK... I'll never, never, never be back.”
Reviews.Author: Maxime_Bck
Reviews.Content: To my mind, it's the WORST ibis Hotel in London. The team of the evening is aggressive with customers. It's crazy. I will never go there again. I prefer spend more cash in a another hotel. First off all, I booked 6 nights but after 12 hours I need left my room. There is a lot of troubleshooting. You can forget your Favorite Guest card, I didn't get a free drink. The room was not clean. Windows were... I don't prefer talk more. Next to the hotel, you have got a lot of others hotel. Please contact them instead of Ibis London Excel. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: N0rtherner
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online through the ACCOR website about 6 days before the stay. I got a really good deal of £45 room only. On arrival check in was swift and the reception area was spacious and busy. There is an internet section, cafe and bar. Parking is underneath both the IBIS and NOVOTELL next door. £14 per night and you have to get the reception to stamp the card before paying at the NOVOTELL. I bought a glass of small rose wine which cost me £4.15 which is quite pricey, I could have bought a bottle for this price and taken it to my room! Later on in the evening I ordered a dessert about 1130pm which was nice and cheap - I think they do 24/7 food. The room was spacious with a huge comfy kingsize bed, linen was soft and nice and pillows OK. Bathroom has a huge shower with shower cream dispenser on wall, the only thing I wasnt happy about was only getting a small towel to dry with and the shower head falling off the holder and cracking me on the head. I got an email to complain about it but I have not yet had any response 3 days later!! The room has TV with pay per view options, an internet connection (at a charge) and tea, coffee making facilities. I didnt sleep very well because although I turned the heating down it turned itself back on constantly but other than this is was a good room for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Excel-lent for the 02 Arena”
Reviews.Author: LadyWard1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before, simply great hotel, value, cleanliness, location for the 02 Arena, speedy check-in and out, great breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel but a few issues”
Reviews.Author: sweeney05
Reviews.Content: Hotel is based pretty near DLR via underpass but still can take an hour to get into the city! Booking process easy online, hotel not especially cheap though for a budget hotel. Reasonable for London however. Room was OK - clean but with cheap fixtures and fittings. Poor insulation from noise outside - hotel right next to busy road. Not impressed with door adjoining room next door: didn't have any problems with guests next door but suspect I would have done if they had been noisy! Bathroom is basic, horrible plastic walk-in effort. No bath for youngsters, shower is in fact "wet room" where entire floor ends up being covered in water and effectively becomes open sewer! Horrible "special needs" chair and seat attached to wall made it feel like a hospital! Cooked buffet breakfast poor – scrambled egg dry and rubbery. Sausages dubious - poor quality. Continental breakfast offerings OK but Dualit toaster wasn’t working properly. On last morning before check out, went for early and quick breakfast, but there was no milk for cereal! The kitchen had run out! We were told a member of staff had popped to shops to buy some more! This is not what I expected from a modern, international hotel in London! We had to wait 20 minutes for milk – we had a train to catch! I complained at reception and received a refund for breakfast – problem resolved to my satisfaction, although it was still a waste of time and made us late. To be fair the woman on reception was professional, polite and efficient when dealing with this matter. Other staff were polite and friendly too – they made me and my four year old son us feel welcome. In general, the staff are the best thing about this hotel. Would go again assuming price is relatively competitive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the 02 - Nice Hotel - Bargain Tariffs”
Reviews.Author: Nay_1988
Reviews.Content: Went to see Beyonce in concert (AMAZING!!) so me and my sister wanted to be close to the 02, so we were not travleling half way across the city when the concert ended! Had to use the DLR line and Jubliee line....really good services ! Only 2 stops and your at the 02....you may even be able to walk there from the hotel (not sure of the route tho). When checked in I explained I wanted to pay for the room on arrival rather than departure (so i didn't spend the money when I was out)..this was fine. However on the second morning/last morning of my stay I went down to have breakfast and the waiter said he would charge the breakfast to my room, and I explained i had already paid for the room so would pay for the breakfast there and then! He said he had no record this and that the room still needed to be paid for! I was not impressed and explained I had a recipt in my room etc. I went and had breakfast (just contintial.....nice tho loats of choice !!!! )and went to reception after to sort it out but the receponist didnt mentioned anything! Which is good I was not in the mood for arguing the fact I had already paid for my bedroom !! The room was really nice ! Nice view over the river, TV worked well and had a good signal! Basic tea and coffee in the room (i took some food of my own). Bathroom good...shower very powerful :) :) Only 20 minutes into central London so perfect for exploring the city !! Overall really nice place and I would stay again and will reccommend to my firends and family :)

Reviews.Title: “Very Modern Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ConniesAdventures
Reviews.Content: I stayed here several nights with a large EF Tour Group. This was an excellent hotel with plenty of amenities. It was large, spacious, and modern. Check in was great. Staff was friendly and helpful. Expect lots of tour groups staying at this hotel. The rooms were comfortable and clean. The hotel was quiet. There is a large marina out back of the hotel and we had nice walks around the water as we watched the swans and boats. There was a small grocery store across the street. It was a great place to stay. Even though the hotel was located far from the center of Longon, the hotel was a short walk from the Tube (subway). The buffet breakfast was the best we had for 16 days in Ireland and the U.K. There was a pay Internet service in the lobby - 20 minutes for 1 pound and a pay telephone. Expect to wait if you want to use the Internet. There was a bar on the first floor. There was plenty of seating in the lobby for just lounging around. The elevators were modern and quick. I would definitely stay here again on a trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “good price and location for london”
Reviews.Author: buttercup78
Reviews.Content: i originally booked this hotel for the michael jackson tour at the o2 and decided to still spend the weekend in london after his death. ive got to say im suprised by the other comments on here. i had no problems whatsoever. nice smooth check in - yes we paid on arrival - whats the problem with that? car parking is next door the ibis shares this with novotel and is £12 per night. the hotel rooms yet basic provide a very clean bed and shower for a weekend in london. we were on the 7th floor and had a nice view over the river. i cant comment on breakfast as i didnt have it but opposite the hotel is a nisa shop that has fresh coffee and croissants. the hotel is right next to excel on a new development mainly of apartments and two other hotels. there is the nisa shop a spar and a few bars/bistros i got the impression there was more to come. the DLR station royal victoria is a 3 min walk from the hotel and is around 15-20 mins to central london. the offpeak (weekend) day pass is £6.30 (not an outragous amount to pay for all day hopping on and off the tube) overall this is very good, clean, value for money, if you want plush pillows, hairdryers toiletries, etc go pay the £240 per night next door.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, shame about the staff and the location”
Reviews.Author: Denise86
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ibis Excel for 1 night. We weren't expecting anything fantastic but were still disappointed in general. On the plus side the room was spotless and we had a good view of the river and the O2. On the downside, the reception staff were rude and uncommunicative and it took absolutely ages to check-in. Before we arrived we were told we would be able to check-in early yet when we got there were told it wasn't possible as no rooms were available just 1 hour early - find this hard to believe. If we'd not been told otherwise, we wouldn't have bothered trecking across London just to drop our bags off. The door to our room didn't lock properly. The hotel location isn't very handy for anything really. In general, I don't think it is even worth £65 a night. The quality of the hotel was what I'd expect if paying more like £40. Breakfast was ok - although choice was limited even for a continental breakfast. I wouldn't stay here again, its worth paying the few quid extra to stay in town so you don't waste half you're time on the tube.

Reviews.Title: “poor hotel”
Reviews.Author: vinchy
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend night- hot stauffy day- told hotel ahd heating but no air conditioning .Poor reception by reception staff-poor language of english spoken.Wrong room given twice to me - x1 room could hear loud voices- would not open door! IMy room key was given to another couple who unlooked my room(no fault of theirs ) and were embrassed.When i complained - i was offered a voucher for 1/2 a pint of beer for my traells up and down the hotel 3 times with mis matched rooms, others intruding in the room etc... What a joke! i will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for o2”
Reviews.Author: dollery8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a Tina Turner Concert at the O2. Very good for access to o2 and excel. It's a very short walk from Custom house Docklands Light railway and is next to the Excel centre, takes about 30 mins from central london but again very easy. For the o2 it was 2 stops to canning town then 1 stop down to North Greenwich and the o2, very easy. And coming back from the concert was no problem as the crowds seemed to go the opposite way to us. The hotel is right on the docks and if you ask for a room on the waterside you can see the o2 from your window. First impressions very good, staff very attentive,hotel and rooms were very clean. Rooms are very basic but clean with a low bed with foam matress and bathroom pod with very good shower. Breakfast is Continental only from a buffet but very good choice rolls, cereal etc. Only problem was kids in the hotel, seemed like school kids staying while they go to school in city. When we arrived back at midnight a group of them in pyjamas were at reception and they were running up and down corridors.They continued to make a noise until about 4:30 am no one seemed to be supervising them and i was kept awake all night.When i poked my head out of the door one of them did apologise. I should of complained but was too tired. Overall a great hotel but if you do stay see if you can request a room away from the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, Comfortable and Polite Staff.”
Reviews.Author: DisabledTraveler
Reviews.Content: Myself and friends have stayed in this hotel a couple of times. It is really close to the Excel Centre as that was where we were going. The staff are friendly here and try and help you out with any problems that you may have. There is a carpark which is underneath the Novotel Hotel but the Ibis customers can use this, it is great value compared to the Excel Carpark. When i went it was about £12 for 24 hours. The rooms are quite spacious, was always clean and tidy when i went. The Bar is good value, you can get food from the bar once the restaurant is closed.

Reviews.Title: “Like Camping”
Reviews.Author: EmmaPLondon
Reviews.Content: We were attending a party in the docklands for NYE and decided to stay at the Ibis Excel rather than getting taxis home. It cost £88 for the room. I was aware that it was only a 2 star hotel, however the fact that the hotel was only built a few years ago and the positive reviews on this site perhaps led me into a false sense of security. The best way to describe the rooms is 'Caravan Like' the decor, bed and minimal furnature were exactly like the interior of a caravan! The bathroom was a single white plastic moulded unit (shower moulds into wall, then into sink) which appears to have been plonked into the room, its also tiny! Ours smelt terribly of drains/sewage too, lovely. There is no Iron or Hairdryers in the rooms. Hairdryers can be borrowed form reception and there are 'Ironing rooms' located on two of the floors! Not fun wile getting ready for NYE and having to get the lift to another floor then queue for 10 mins to Iron your frock in front of other hotel guests!! This seemed even stranger for a hotel which is predominatly for business users! Pehaps if this was more clearly advertised it wouldnt have been such an issue. The staff were not nessacarliy rude, but would just clearly rather be somewhere else. There was only one barman, and each time we ordered drinks we had to request our change!! Im all for tipping but a least let me have the option!! Check in/Check out was quick and hassle free though. Overall I would say that this is purely somewhere to rest your head for the night, If you are planning to make a weekend out of a trip to the o2 then perhaps another hotel might be better!

Reviews.Title: “Ibis was a great deal with a great view of london from our room”
Reviews.Author: teress
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I needed a hotel when we found that the one we had originally booked on line was a dump! Upon seeing the dump hotel, we walked out and met a wonderful Canadian Couple (yea for the friendly Canadians) who told us about the Ibis by Earl's Court tube. We took a taxi and found a nice hotel in a working class area. We were about one block from the tube with a wonderful Brit employee who helped us use the Tube to get all over London. The Hotel Ibis was affordable, clean, air conditioned, had wonderful food, and our room was large with a grand view of the London Skyline! The staff was professional and polite. The buffet restaurant people evern gave me two big bowls of soup to eat in our room on the first night because we were too tired to eat out. We mostly ate at the neighborhood restaurants and pubs. It was wonderful because the food in London can be costly for an American if you figure that a 5 pound plate is really equivalent to $10.00 American! Every morning we would split a 5 pond plate of backed beans, two slces of ham, toast, hash browns, and sausage! This hotel and the neighborhood made out London stay fantastic. T & K

Reviews.Title: “Good Enough”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Kenobi
Reviews.Content: It's an Ibis hotel, so be prepared for loads of teenage tour groups! I was in one of them. This isn't really a problem since the walls are thick enough, and the teens seem to contain their frivolity to the lobby. Unfortunately, there's only one telephone in the lobby and if you happen to need that phone, be prepared to have to yell to hear yourself over the billions of Columbian adolescent girls squealing in your ear. Well, that's what happened to us. The bar is nice though. They have a decent selection of beer and a large television showing random bar type programing. The rooms are clean, and big enough for my roommate, me, and our suitcases. The location would have been terrific since there is a train station just steps away from the hotel, but there happened to be some Christian revival going on at the Expo, which the station empties into, and we couldn't get back to our hotel either nights! We had to walk blocks and blocks around and over the river to eventually get back. This isn't anything against the hotel, but the British cops can be a bit wacky when it comes to events. The service seemed okay. The bartender was a bit slow, but it was busy, so I understand. I'm not sure about other services as I didn't require anything special. Although, when my tour group was going to stay out late, my parents returned to the hotel early by taxi, and they were able to get their key, and luggage from the storage room (we had to check in early). So they were accomodating in that regard. So, busy, but decent. I'd stay there again. I'd just make sure nothing is happening at the expo next door before I book a room.

Reviews.Title: “It's an Ibis!”
Reviews.Author: BlueSquareThing
Reviews.Content: This is an Ibis hotel. That means you pay a reasonable amount and get the standard Ibis service - fine but no great frills. If you want great luxury then go someplace else. If you want a fair price for an OK bed in London with reasonable services then this is fine. For me, three major plus points: fairly easy to get to and from the centre; air con; quiet (didn't hear a plane at all inside the hotel). A desk to work at, a bar to get a beer at and a reasonable shower were good bonuses. The food's not great, but it's an Ibis so it's what I expected. I obviously didn't get caught up in huge tour parties which could be a problem I guess, but I'll stay here again when I need to be in London working.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!!! Avoid!!”
Reviews.Author: SnowyP
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel just past midnight, having booked it four months in advance, to be told that they had no room for us!!! They taxied us to their Barking hotel, which was no where near any underground station and gave us a mere £10 reduction for our trouble!! So if you book this hotel, I recommend, you telephone on the day to check they have not given your room away to someone else. I thought this sort of thing only happened in Spain!!!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely small rooms, but clean interior”
Reviews.Author: SemolinaPilchard
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights with a bunch of EF tour groups (made up of high school and older middle school kids). When my group first went inside the hotel, we were pleased to see a very modern interior design. It didn't look like a nasty, cheap hotel; it was actually quite pretty. Hope that you won't get stuck in the hotel on a bad day, though. Since there were 300 kids staying in the hotel that night, and we had similar schedules, many times, I would have to wait more than five minutes for the elevator, or lift, I guess, to come to my floor. And by the time I got on the lift, more and more people would try to stuff themselves in and the just the trip going downstairs was terrible. Everyday, I had to take the stairs (WHICH ARE NOT EASY TO CLIMB UP AND DOWN!) so I often had a workout, even though I don't really need one... The rooms are TERRIBLY small, smallest I had ever seen. I think my college's dorm room will be bigger than what I saw! There are up to two beds in there and if you have a third guest, you can have a fold out bed near the window. The TV's quite small too with not too many channels (not interesting ones, too). Overall, the room was clean. The restroom (or washroom, I guess) was ALSO VERY SMALL! I remember how difficult it was to just go to the washroom...The weird door with NO LOCK (very very bad...I remember one of my roommates intruded on another still inside the washroom without knocking and my other roommate got really mad) and I remember the shower was weird, too. Oh yes, I remember; the shower cover was very weird with HOLES in it! so if the shower accidentally sprayed outwards, even with the shower cover there, the water can spray on the washroom floor! I remember the room floor was all wet when I stepped out! Another thing, there's no bath tub and the shower floor is almost flat, so the water can run under the shower cover and go on the washroom floor. The washroom, however, was also clean. It's nice that the London Underground is so closeby the hotel, which is perfect for anyone who is visiting. ESPECIALLY business people who are always on the go! It takes maybe 2-3 minutes to walk to the station. This hotel is probably the best for business people, since the rooms are so small, they look like they should house only one person. The one thing I hate about this hotel is no free wi-fi internet connection! But what I loved is that there's a free phone you can use downstairs! At least it was free when I was there. But the lines for the phone were long for me, especially since we were ALL from outside the country. Still great for business people always making calls! Breakfast is not bad, but you get very sick of it. I hated croissants after that. If you happen to regret your stay at Ibis and you're looking for a nicer stay immediately, try Novotel next door to Ibis.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break Away”
Reviews.Author: PCEFLECFLN
Reviews.Content: Initially I was going to stay at another hotel, but then read reviews on this page that made me think twice. A couple of posters gave me the heads up on the Ibis Excel and after checking its reviews on here I decided to go ahead and book it. I just got back today! I visited London with my 11 year old son for a respite break from fostering, we were looking for a hotel to use as a base after busy days sightseeing. The hotel is situated at the Docklands which initially seems a bit of a way out from Central London, but once you get on the jubilee line its a straight ride through to Canning Town and then just one stop on the DLR to Royal Victoria. you need a travel card to cover zones 1 to 3. The hotel is a 5 minute walk from th DLR, exit the station take a right and then follow the road as it bears around to the left its right next to the Excel centre (i put the directions down because we couldnt find it when we got off the DLR and wandered around nervously for a bit and there were loads of workmen around as the area near the DLR is under development) The hotel was just £55.00 a night and so for 4 nights we only paid £220.00. It was half term as well and so we expected it to cost more. (Breakfast not included £5.50 for adults and half for children under 11) The first impression was good, the hotel was clean, the carpets/floor, the tables, the bar was well stocked and the waiting area was bustling with life as many guests sat around comfortably having a drink and having a laugh. The hotel reception staff were very friendly and helpful which put me at immediate ease as this was the first time I had travelled to London for fun rather than on business or training. We were served quickly and efficiently and given directions to our room, which was a bit small but was situated on the 3rd floor and had an amazing view of the waterfront. (the morning views were amazing) The bathroom was spacious and the shower was huge and very powerful. The bathroom was very clean also. Tea and coffe faciilities in the room as standard.. The double bed was comfortable and there was a single bed in the room too. There was sufficient wardrobe space but not enough storage space for our cases which ended up on either side of the bed which was a bit inconvenient, but not major at all! The rooms were cleaned well each day and re stocked with all facilities. We ordered food from the bar on one night only because the restaurant said it would be 40 minutes as they were so busy, but the service at the bar was good, if a touch pricey. £7.50 for a v small margherita pizza. Drinks were overpriced too £1.80 for a tiny glass of coke, seemed less than a regular 330ml cans worth! overall we were very pleased with the Ibis Excel and decided that it was a good value stay and the next time we went to London we would definately book there. (top tip, make sure you leave over an hour travelling time to get back to Kings Cross, we only just made our train this morning as there's such a long journey back to central London.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kylieclyde
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister stayed here for one night as we were down to see the Spice Girls :) It was a great hotel to stay in but we only stayed for one night, i might feel a bit different if it was 4 or 5 days as the rooms are quite small. They were clean and the view from our room was amazing, right on the water. The staff were ok, we were asking how to get to Madame Tussauds and they didnt have a clue what i was on about so ended up having to look up the net ourselves but managed to get the directions to the tube from them, which was only 5 minutes away! We got an all day ticket for the tube for £5 which got us to madame tussuds and the o2 arena. We tried to phone a taxi company but they were going to charge £30 to get there and back to and from the o2 arena. The area around the hotel seemed like a ghost town there was nobody about anywhere. The bars that were near the hotel where empty. I think this may be the time of year that we went as everybody would have left after the new year. We got 2 diet cokes from the bar before we went to bed and it cost £3.50 so god knows what the alcoholic drinks cost! The breakfast was great you can take as much as you want from a large choice of fruit, yoghurts, bread, meat, baguettes, croissants, muffins, tea & coffee. The only thing that really worried me was when we were leaving we asked the receptionist to call us a taxi. When the taxi arrived it was unmarked and there was no meter in the car so i think it was an unlicensed cabbie.... not a good move as we are two young girls travelling alone! He charged us £8 to the airport which is what we paid there anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: Mona216
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay here is if you have business at the Excel Centre- even so it might be worth it to travel in from central London. On the positive side- the facilities are clean, even if the rooms are small. The location across from the Excel Centre is excellent for the business traveller. Downside, staff were unhelpful and in some cases frankly rude. There is one public computer in the 'business centre' and as I experienced at another Ibis hotel in London, Internet access is easy only if you're affiliated with the Orange telecommunications group. Not ideal! Surrounding restaurants tend to be pricey, but if you must stay in this area, I'd recommend the Caribbean restaurant on the waterfront ( 3 minutes walk from the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Lets not get carried away”
Reviews.Author: SJP165
Reviews.Content: The previous reviewer I would suggest has got carried away with what IMHO is a good utility hotel worth what you pay for it. A box with rooms however with a great view over the London dock area. No real facilities apart from a reception and combined bar/eating area. Location v good for both ExCel, O2 Arena and not much of Tube ride into Central London. However, it;s basic albeit clean and quiet. Bed somewhat hard, a tardis of a bathroom but fine if all you want is some shut eye during the night. By day it;'s right under the London City airport flightpath. It was worth the £65 I paid for the room. Nothing more but certainly as a crash pad after last nights Led Zeppelin concert it was quite, convenient, clean and not too uncomfortable. If I'd taken my wife, and I'd been the other end of London we would have stayed at the ParkCity in Kensington. OK not in the same price league, and not convenient to the O2 but divisions better. For what it is, and where it is I'd suggest you're ok at this hotel as long as you're looking for a bed, a shower and a beer.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience And I have travelled the world!”
Reviews.Author: Lex59
Reviews.Content: I am in Tourism and as such attended World Travel Market. A friend of mine works that exhibition and booked an extra room and offered it to me, even at no cost it was disgusting. I am shocked to read some of these reviews as it was the most appalling experience I ever had in my life. In fact as guests walked down this was consistently the talk on the lifts (elevators) and all public areas, namely how appalling the place was. The hotel staff were rude, not just unfriendly or unhlepful but outright rude. The rooms were so basic it was frightening. As you enter it smells musty or something, then you realise that your bed is two small beds on a wood frame that is half the size of a normal single. the mattress is thin, almost like they would issue in a jail or at a summer camp. The sheets dirty (place a dot with a pen on your pillow and sheets the first day and you will see them until you leave. The shower is clean but the entire bathroom is a cubicle built into the room. Water fluctuates so you may have it on hot and get a burst of cold and adjust it hotter then get burnt, I complained but this went unanswered. They give you two towels that are somewhere between hand and body towels, very odd. Almost none of their staff has a true fluid prooficiency of English, most being imported from France, and the service is reminiscent of being in the worst sections of Paris. They claim to offer wifi yet when I paid and did not get and used it and it went out, FOUR times, they not only would not call the company on a free phone number for me, but they did and put through to my room later to charge me a pound for each of the four calls, I was astounded. If you are the camping/trailer type then this may be acceptable for you, but if you need to stay in accomodations more than what you would expect a jail to offer, by all means go spend the extra 30 pounds a night and stay at the stellar hotels nearby like the sister Novotel and the Crowne Plaza both of which are fabulous and offer great service and nice rooms. The Ibis was built mainly to bilk people out of money during peak exhibitions when the other hotels fill up, sorry I would rather pay for the cab ride and stay off site next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MS09090909
Reviews.Content: Absolutely wonderful hotel. Very clean, has a great continental breakfast. It is not in the city but easily accessible by light rail. Only a short walk to the DLR station. Definitly bring a hairdryer though they were out during my entire stay and they don't have them in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good...”
Reviews.Author: MrsPScot
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and clean, slightly overcrowed due to amount of guest staying, the food was lovely. One thing that did concern me was that a couple of items went missing from our room, i did say say to the receptionsit and i did say say that it wasnt a big deal as that it only amounted to about £1 worth of stuff but the receptionist laughed when i walked away which i wasnt too pleased about and felt that it should of been taken seriously respective of wether i want to make an issue of it or not. due to this fact it be unlikey that i will stay there again and due to ongoing development in the area i may stay in neighbouring hotels.

Reviews.Title: “london short-trip”
Reviews.Author: explorersBLR
Reviews.Content: like all ibis hotels, ibis has its own standards and you can trust on them. ibis excel, london was excellent, within 20 min u r in london city. the hotel is easy to find and offers an beautiful view to the royal victoria docks & themse. So make sure to book a room in one of the upper floors. (just take DLR to royal victoria dock station from the city) we stayed for a long weekend (bank holidays in uk) at ibis and got a very good rate for london: 40 GBP per night (special offer from the hotels website) Usually it is hard to find a room in a private B&B at this rate in london. The service was very good. The room is clean and the bathroom is small, but very clean. Good breakfast also. In addition to that they give a water boiler and instant coffee and tea every day into your room, when they do room service. good service/value for less money !

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: mrspink3
Reviews.Content: Stayed just 2 nights but a great value hotel in an expensive city. Loved the water by side it and the few bars close by. Would go again. The hotel is 2 mins walk to the Docklands Light Railway and for £5.20 a day you can hop on and off of the tube, DLR and the buses. Had a great time.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Ibis London Excel-Docklands
HotelInfo.Address: 9 Western Gateway | Royal Victoria Dock, London E16 1AB, England
